meanings.definition: To cut off the head of (someone)
meanings.sent1: The evil king ordered his soldiers to behead the prisoner.
meanings.sent2: The executioner used a sharp sword to behead the criminal.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the villain plotted to behead the hero, but his plan was foiled.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully beheaded the fish before cooking it.
meanings.sent5: The guillotine was used in the past to behead criminals quickly.

meanings.definition: To remove the head or top of (something)
meanings.sent1: The gardener had to behead the wilting flowers to promote new growth.
meanings.sent2: The top of the mountain was beheaded by a massive avalanche.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally beheaded the mannequin while practicing his skills.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds beheaded the tall trees in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The sculpture artist decided to behead the statue to give it a modern twist.
